instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT is PPBUS_G3H backlight voltage entering the backlight boost circuit once the transistor has been told to allow it through. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 No Backlight
threads.message:
Hi Guys.

I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 board no backlight. No liquid damage just stopped. I'm missing <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>, voltage present on <RESISTOR>R8400</RESISTOR> contacts 1,2,4.

<TRANSISTOR>Q8400</TRANSISTOR> pin 4 13v, pin 3 13v and others no present <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> which also means <SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_LCDBKLT_SW</SIGNAL> not present.

Any ideas? 

Thanks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 No Backlight
threads.message:
First confirm if you get image on internal LCD.
If not present, check external video at least.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 No Backlight
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 No Backlight
threads.message:
No pulse at all at <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>, at the moment when the image appears?
Try another compatible LCD assembly.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 No Backlight
threads.message: <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> present all the time when lcd is connected. <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_SW</SIGNAL> is missing going to <TRANSISTOR>Q8401</TRANSISTOR> all other on mosfet are present

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 No Backlight
threads.message: It was playing with the voltages but last time when i measured and saw  <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_SW</SIGNAL>  is missing i resoldered <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> and solved the issue :D

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 No Backlight
threads.message:
Glad to hear is solved.

For the future, post accurate info please; you've mentioned in the first post no <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> present...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 No Backlight
